trans-unit.source: How to move a VM or role instance to a different subnet
trans-unit.target: How to move a VM or role instance to a different subnet

trans-unit.source: Learn how to move VMs and role instances to a different subnet
trans-unit.target: Learn how to move VMs and role instances to a different subnet

trans-unit.source: How to move a VM or role instance to a different subnet
trans-unit.target: How to move a VM or role instance to a different subnet

trans-unit.source: You can use PowerShell to move your VMs from one subnet to another in the same virtual network (VNet).
trans-unit.target: You can use PowerShell to move your VMs from one subnet to another in the same virtual network (VNet).

trans-unit.source: Role instances can be moved by editing the CSCFG, rather than using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Role instances can be moved by editing the CSCFG, rather than using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Why move VMs to another subnet?
trans-unit.target: Why move VMs to another subnet?

trans-unit.source: Subnet migration is useful when the older subnet is too small and cannot be expanded due to existing running VMs in that subnet.
trans-unit.target: Subnet migration is useful when the older subnet is too small and cannot be expanded due to existing running VMs in that subnet.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you can create a new, larger subnet and migrate the VMs to the new subnet, then after migration is complete, you can delete the old empty subnet.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you can create a new, larger subnet and migrate the VMs to the new subnet, then after migration is complete, you can delete the old empty subnet.

trans-unit.source: How to move a VM to another subnet
trans-unit.target: How to move a VM to another subnet

trans-unit.source: To move a VM, run the Set-AzureSubnet PowerShell cmdlet, using the example below as a template.
trans-unit.target: To move a VM, run the Set-AzureSubnet PowerShell cmdlet, using the example below as a template.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, we are moving TestVM from its present subnet, to Subnet-2.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, we are moving TestVM from its present subnet, to Subnet-2.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to edit the example to reflect your environment.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to edit the example to reflect your environment.

trans-unit.source: Note that whenever you run the Update-AzureVM cmdlet as part of a procedure, it will restart your VM as part of the update process.
trans-unit.target: Note that whenever you run the Update-AzureVM cmdlet as part of a procedure, it will restart your VM as part of the update process.

trans-unit.source: If you specified a static DIP for your VM, you'll have to clear that setting before you can move the VM to a new subnet.
trans-unit.target: If you specified a static DIP for your VM, you'll have to clear that setting before you can move the VM to a new subnet.

trans-unit.source: In that case, use the following:
trans-unit.target: In that case, use the following:

trans-unit.source: To move a role instance to another subnet
trans-unit.target: To move a role instance to another subnet

trans-unit.source: To move a role instance, edit the CSCFG file.
trans-unit.target: To move a role instance, edit the CSCFG file.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, we are moving "Role0" in virtual network VNETName from its present subnet to Subnet-2.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, we are moving "Role0" in virtual network VNETName from its present subnet to Subnet-2.

trans-unit.source: Because the role instance was already deployed, you'll just change the Subnet name = Subnet-2.
trans-unit.target: Because the role instance was already deployed, you'll just change the Subnet name = Subnet-2.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to edit the example to reflect your environment.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to edit the example to reflect your environment.
